summary_list: [{'summary': "Electronic Arts (EA) reported total net revenue of $7,426 million for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, representing a 6% increase compared to the previous year. Live services and other net revenue, which includes extra content and subscriptions, also saw a significant increase of 10% year-over-year. summary_list: [{'summary': 'For the year ended December 31, 2021, Citrix reported a slight decline in total net revenue of 0.6% to $3.22 billion. Subscription revenue increased by 39.4% to $1.55 billion, driven by customer cloud adoption and an increase in on-premise license demand. However, product and license revenue decreased by 61.5% to $171.2 million due to the discontinuation of new perpetual licenses for Citrix Workspace. Support and services revenue decreased by 11.0% to $1.49 billion, primarily due to decreased sales of maintenance services. The gross margin as a percentage of revenue decreased from 84.6% to 80.6% due to the end of sale of Workspace perpetual licenses and the Wrike acquisition.
